snippet: Expansion in July slows by 10 percentage points compared with June, raising expectations of imminent government action.
abstract: Labor Department data shows that growth in overseas shipments from China ground to a near halt in July, with exports up just 1 percent from the same month a year earlier, far below expectations and well beneath the 11.3 percent in June; data reinforces expectations that Beijing will soon step up its efforts to buttress growth before a key leadership transition in the fall.
lead_paragraph: Expansion in July slows by 10 percentage points compared with June, raising expectations of imminent government action.

headline.print_headline: Signaling a Stalling Economy, China’s Export Growth Is Almost at a Standstill
